Articles.Content:
no.

press for a squad of republic commandos. but also explodes a planet on the other side of the universe.

Well the explosion would be so far away it would take so long to get to me and I'd be dead by then so *boop*

Press the button to not feel pain or anything (can be dangerous as you cannot feel it when you get cut bad and you might bleed to death).

I am smart enough to realize if I am hurt, so yes.

Press the button to horribly kill someone who is about to kill you, but they come back as very slow and weak zombies a few days later.

Boop, cuz I blow head off

Press the button to contain Freddy Fazabear but has a 5% chance of releasing SCP-001

I'm not going to risk it considering that I don't know what any of that stuff is.

The button contains the kraken, but it has a 20% chanse of releasing a second one.

definite no

press the button to bring about world peace but technological progress will stagnate for about a few hundred years

Technology might just do that anyway, so no.

The button will advance science 100 years, but it will start the robot apocolipse.

(On my previous post when I said that the button contains the kraken, I meant that it puts the kraken in containment, not that the kraken is in the button. I just noticed how misleading that was)

I will definitely push that button.

Push this button to be thrown into the air two thousand meters (~1.25 miles). You will not be harmed by anything in your way or the impact.

Press it, it'll be like skydiving, but free. (inb4 it's a trap)

Press the button to obtain 10 dollars.

Yes, i need it for the steam exploration sale

press to learn about one of the possible futures of your life

Yo will press it, but hesitantly because I watch doctor who.

The button is reusable and it sends you 10 seconds back in time.

There would be no point in pressing it, so no.

The button teleports you to KSC and you turn into a Kerbal.

PRESS!!

This button puts you into a lottery.

You could get:

$20,000

$100,000

$1

$20

Press, because even if I get the worst possible thing, it's still a free dollar!

Press the button to turn all letters lowercase.

Make sure nobody ever presses that button.

This button removes all spelling and grammar errors, but every time you make one (that is immediately corrected), you get a painful electric shock.

Press. *best heroic fantasy voice* This gift to the world must not be squandered, even at my own self-risk.

The button gives you 100$, however it is all in a random foreign currency, possibly made by a civilization that may not even exist anymore (but not one from the future) (100$ being in USD for conversion purposes, let's say)

I push it. If it's my currency, I'm happy, if it's a modern foreign currency, I can exchange it and I'm happy, if it's some ancient currency, I'll just give it to some museum or so.

Push this button to return one of the Voyager probes back to a NASA facility where it is safe immediately.

But then the aliens won't find it, I am not pressing that.

The button will put you on a rocket going to Mars that has a 10% chanse of exploding on liftoff.

*boop* Deal!

Press to go *boom*

No, why would I want that?

The button will bring Jeb into the real world.

Uh. No If he flies a Nuclear bomber XD

Press the button and fire ze missiles.

At what? I am not going to risk it.

The button teleports you to a random planet or moon in the solar system that has a surface and gives you a space suit that can survive the conditions encountered and means of return, but the return might take a while if you are on a moon of Saturn or something.

*BOOP*

Press button to flip the Americas (South will be at north, North will be at south).

I have always wanted to see the southern stars. *PRESS*

The button teleports you to the International Space Station, but you are on your own when it comes to going back to Earth.

By the way Overfloater, congrats on getting your .gif noticed by the KSP devs on fan-work Friday!

Edited December 1, 2014 by mikeman7918

Nah. I don't want the space agencies of earth to have to rethink it's entire mission planning to get me back to earth/send a bit more food up.

Press to have excellent eyesight, but poorer hearing.
